triples.name: Theorem prover
triples.relevance: The paper uses mechanical theorem provers to formally verify probabilistic algorithms.

triples.name: Probability theory
triples.relevance: The foundation for the formal framework verifying probabilistic algorithms and their specifications.

triples.name: Measure (mathematics)
triples.relevance: Paper develops a foundational higher-order logic formalization of measure theory for probability spaces.

triples.name: Probability space
triples.relevance: Paper proposes a novel probability space model for random bit generators as infinite sequences of Bernoulli variables.

triples.name: Bernoulli distribution
triples.relevance: Paper models random bit generators as IID Bernoulli(1/2) random variables in the probability space.

triples.name: Monad (functional programming)
triples.relevance: Paper uses state-transformer monad from functional programming to model probabilistic computations.

triples.name: Random walk
triples.relevance: Paper verifies a symmetric simple random walk as an example probabilistic program.

triples.name: Miller-Rabin primality test
triples.relevance: Paper verifies this well-known commercial probabilistic algorithm with strong properties in the formal framework.
